Question
========

Randomly select an employee in a firm. A is the set of all female employees and B of the employees with a managerial position. We assume that A and B are independent of each other. It holds that P(A) = 0.46, P(B) = 0.15. what is the conditional probability that choose a woman, if it is given that the randomly chosen person has a managerial position?

Answerlist
----------

* 0,15
* 0,32
* 0,46
* 0,78

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.15: Incorrect
* 0.32: Incorrect
* 0.46: Correct
* 0.78: Incorrect
